Package network

Class Client

java.lang.Object
network.Client
public class Client extends Object
Client network object of the program. Contains functions for sending, receiving, and pinging target host. Also handles file writing.
Author:
Escalona, J.M.

    • Client

      public Client(String host, int port, int BUFFER_SIZE)
      Builds a Client object
      Parameters:
      host - Target host
      port - Target port
      BUFFER_SIZE - buffersize of packets, set as <= 0 if default

  • Method Details

    • setDefaults

      public void setDefaults()
      Sets the Client's default connection target to: 'localhost:69' for a TFTP connection.

    • setBufferSize

      public void setBufferSize(int BUFFER_SIZE)
      Sets the BUFFER SIZE of the TFTP transmission.
      Parameters:
      BUFFER_SIZE -

    • send

      public boolean send(File f, String[] opts, String[] vals)
      Delegates sending of File to TFTP server connected by socket using the TFTP protocol instructions.
      Parameters:
      f - File to be sent.
      opts - Options
      vals - Option values
      Returns:
      True if successful, false if an valid/acceptable error occurs.

    • receive

      public File receive(String filename, String saveAs, String[] opts, String[] vals)
      Delegates receiving of File to TFTP server connected by socket using the TFTP protocol instructions.
      Parameters:
      filename - Filename of the file intended.
      saveAs - Specified filename of user when downloaded.
      opts - Options
      vals - Option values
      Returns:
      Tempfile pointed at /downloads in program's folder.

      TODO Ask permission to write file on the server connected to this Client.
      Parameters:
      f - File to write permission to.
      Returns:
      True if allowed, false if otherwise.

    • writeToServer

      private boolean writeToServer(File f, String[] opts, String[] vals)
      TODO Write file to the server. File Bytestream Reference: https://www.codejava.net/java-se/file-io/java-io-fileinputstream-and-fileoutputstream-examples
      Parameters:
      f - File to be transferred.
      Returns:
      True if transfer completed, false if otherwise or fatal error/exception occurred.

    • readFromServer

      private File readFromServer(String filename, File tempFile, String[] opts, String[] vals)
      TODO Read File from server. File Bytestream Reference: https://www.codejava.net/java-se/file-io/java-io-fileinputstream-and-fileoutputstream-examples
      Parameters:
      filename - Filename of target file on server.
      tempFile - File where the bytes will be placed.
      Returns:
      File pointer with the TFTP bytes.
